question: 人工
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>person</kanji> of <kanji>industry</kanji> makes a lot of things by hand, so everything they make is <vocabulary>artificial</vocabulary>, and also means it's <vocabulary>man made</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>人</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Remember this by thinking about how <reading>jean</reading>s (<ja>じん</ja>) are <vocabulary>artificial</vocabulary>. You've never seen jeans growing on trees, right? Nope, jeans are 100% <vocabulary>man made</vocabulary>.
